Key Match Events: Giorgi Chakvetadze scored the opening goal for Georgia by converting a penalty.
Giorgi Chakvetadze scored again by squeezing the ball under Matej Kovar.
Georges Mikautadze scored a clinical first-time volley from Luka Lochoshvili’s cross.
Giorgi Kochorashvili scored with a header after a pass from Giorgi Chakvetadze.
Lukas Kalvach scored a consolation goal for the Czech Republic in the 80th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Georges Mikautadze was awarded for being the top scorer at Euro 2024 before the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia started their UEFA Nations League Group B1 campaign with a 4-1 victory over the Czech Republic.
Georgia went a fifth consecutive match unbeaten in Tbilisi.
Czech Republic followed up their worst Euros as an independent nation with a fifth consecutive UNL defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Matej Rynes was forced off injured before the half-hour mark.
Giorgi Chakvetadze was named Flashscore Man of the Match.
